document_metadata.name: Assembly and structure of protein phosphatase 2A

citation.db_name: Assembly and structure of protein phosphatase 2A.
citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

citation.db_name: Assembly and structure of protein phosphatase 2A.
citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

links.evidence: To gain full activity towards specific substrates, the PP2A core enzyme interacts with a variable regulatory subunit to form a heterotrimeric holoenzyme. The variable regulatory subunits consist of four families: B (also known as B55 or PR55), Bâ² (B56 or PR61), Bâ²â² (PR48/PR72/PR130), and Bâ²â²â² (PR93/PR110), with at least 16 members in these families

links.evidence: Except the Bâ²â²â² subunits, direct interactions between the PP2A core enzyme and the regulatory subunits have been demonstrated

links.evidence: Reversible methylation of PP2A is catalyzed by two highly conserved and PP2A-specific enzymes, leucine carboxyl methyltransferase (LCMT1)[21,33] and PP2A methylesterase (PME-1)[17] (Figure 1).

citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

links.evidence: Furthermore, formation of a stable complex between PP2A and PME-1 likely blocks LCMT1-catalyzed methylation.

citation.db_name: Assembly and structure of protein phosphatase 2A.
citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

links.evidence: PME-1 catalyzes removal of the methyl group, thus reversing the activity of LCMT1

citation.db_name: Assembly and structure of protein phosphatase 2A.
citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

links.evidence: A portion of cellular PP2A stably associated with PME-1 and was catalytically inactive [80]; intriguingly, this inactive portion of PP2A could be re-activated by PP2A phosphatase activator (PTPA), but not by LCMT1, ruling out the possibility that inactivation was solely caused by demethylation

citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

links.evidence: Furthermore, formation of a stable complex between PP2A and PME-1 likely blocks LCMT1-catalyzed methylation.

citation.db_name: Assembly and structure of protein phosphatase 2A.
citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

links.evidence: A portion of cellular PP2A stably associated with PME-1 and was catalytically inactive [80]; intriguingly, this inactive portion of PP2A could be re-activated by PP2A phosphatase activator (PTPA), but not by LCMT1, ruling out the possibility that inactivation was solely caused by demethylation

citation.db_name: Assembly and structure of protein phosphatase 2A.
citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

links.evidence: Deletion of PTPA homologs in yeast, rrd1/rrd2, resulted in elevated levels of stable PP2A-PME-1 complexes, accompanied by decreased methylation

citation.db_name: Assembly and structure of protein phosphatase 2A.
citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

links.evidence: Deletion of PTPA homologs in yeast, rrd1/rrd2, resulted in elevated levels of stable PP2A-PME-1 complexes, accompanied by decreased methylation

citation.db_name: Assembly and structure of protein phosphatase 2A.
citation.journal: Science in China. Series C, Life sciences

links.evidence: The PP2A core enzyme, upon initial incubation with various concentrations of PME-1, exhibited full Ser/Thr phosphatase activity and, only after prolonged incubation time, had substantial loss of the phosphatase activity
